metadata.title: CVE-2022-2785 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low
metadata.description:
There exists an arbitrary memory read within the Linux Kernel BPF -Constants provided to fill pointers in structs passed in to bpf_sys_bpf arenot verified and can point anywhere, including memory not owned by BPF. Anattacker with CAP_BPF can arbitrarily read memory from anywhere on thesystem. We recommend upgrading past commit 86f44fcec22c

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2785` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-18.18
linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-18.18
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-18.18
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic-64k - 5.19.0-18.18
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-kvm - 5.19.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1009-aws - 5.19.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-azure - 5.19.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-gcp - 5.19.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-ibm - 5.19.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1007-lowlatency - 5.19.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1007-lowlatency-64k - 5.19.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-oracle - 5.19.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-1004-raspi - 5.19.0-1002.6
linux-image-5.19.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 5.19.0-1002.6
No subscription required
